title: Cultural Atlas of Ancient Egypt
One of the very best one-volume references. Maps are plentiful, as are concise site descriptions
The Nile and Its People: 7000 Years of Egyptian History

note: Both volumes can now be downloaded from the MetPublications web-page: www.metmuseum.org/research/metpublications/The_Scepter_of_Egypt_ Vol_1_From_the_Earliest_Times_to_the_End_of_the_Middle_Kingdom www.metmuseum.org/research/metpublications/The_Scepter_of_Egypt_ Vol_2_The_Hyksos_Period_and_the_New_Kingdom_1675_1080_BC APPENDIX: SOURCES FOR FURTHER EXPLORATION 185
title: The Scepter of Egypt
A classic survey of ancient Egyptian history and culture, amply illustrated by objects in the Egyptian collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art

container-title: T.G.H. James, The British Museum Concise Introduction: Ancient Egypt
title: Introduction to Ancient Egypt
A solid introductory textbook
The Penguin Historical Atlas of Ancient Egypt
Great maps and short chapters on a variety of subjects
The Princeton Dictionary of Ancient Egypt
The Oxford Encyclopedia of Ancient Egypt
This three-volume encyclopedia is loaded with articles written by experts on a vast variety of subjects. It is very expensive but can be found for consultation in many university libraries

note: etc., are nicely summarized in this volume keyed to the Egyptian collection of the British Museum.
title: The British Museum Book of Ancient Egypt
History, religious beliefs, arts and crafts

note: Colorfully illustrated and organized by theme.
title: Encyclopedia of Ancient Egypt
Egypt and the Egyptians
The Thames & Hudson Dictionary of Ancient Egypt
The Egyptian World
A survey of ancient Egypt presented through articles written by prominent scholars
authoritative handbooks to the antiquities sites: Roger Bagnall and Dominic Rathbone, Egypt from Alexander to the Copts: An Archaeological and Historical Guide
A detailed examination of the massive temple complex at Luxor
The Fayoum: History and Guide
A fascinating region in Egypt not well known to the average tourist

note: great Professor Murnane, as revised and updated by Aidan Dodson.
title: The Ancient Egypt Guide
An excellent guide by the late
Rough Guide to Egypt
A very practical manual that addresses the needs of visitors at all price ranges

container-title: Also published under the title, Egypt 1250 BC: A Traveler’s Companion
title: Ancient Egypt on Five Deben a Day
An entertaining travel guide for visitors to Egypt in 1250 bc. How to get around, sites to see, what to eat, experiencing the culture, etc., and even a list of useful phrases
A Traveler’s Guide to the Geology of Egypt
Describes the truly ancient history of the actual land of Egypt and the stones put to good use by its people

note: Titles include: The Pyramids, Valley of the Kings and Theban Tombs, Aswan, Sinai, Oases, Coptic Egypt and Islamic Egypt.
title: Alberto Siliotti has written a number of nice “Pocket Guides” to various places in Egypt as published by the American University in Cairo Press
Thebes in Egypt: A Guide to the Tombs and Temples of Ancient Luxor
Great coverage of some of the most important and interesting sites from ancient Egypt
The Western Desert of Egypt: An Explorer’s Handbook
A guide to the major oases and the many other wonders to be found out west
The Illustrated Guide to Luxor: Tombs, Temples, and Museums

note: Describes the period from Alexander the Great to the Arab Conquest.
title: Egypt After the Pharaohs

note: Nefertiti, Tutankhamun, Ay, Horemheb, and the Egyptian Counter-Reformation, 2009; Poisoned Legacy: The Fall of the Nineteenth Egyptian Dynasty, 2010; Afterglow of Empire: Egypt from the Fall of the New Kingdom to the Saite Renaissance, 2012.
title: Aidan Dodson has written a number of very useful volumes that nicely summarize some of the more complicated times in Egyptian history, each published by the American University in Cairo Press: Amarna Sunset
The Middle Kingdom of Ancient Egypt: History, Archaeology and Society
Tombs and Hieroglyphs: A Popular History of Ancient Egypt, updated and revised
An eminently readable and highly recommended classic

container-title: The Oxford History of Ancient Egypt
Rise of Civilization in the Nile
title: The Twilight of Ancient Egypt: The First Millennium BCE
It wasn’t over for Egypt after the New Kingdom!
A volume that has become a standard reference
A History of Ancient Egypt
The Ancient Egyptian State: The Origins of Egyptian Culture
Genesis of the Pharaohs
Civilization didn’t originate overnight! Toby Wilkinson, The Rise and Fall of Ancient Egypt
A somewhat controversial approach that describes a somewhat darker side to ancient Egyptian culture and history
The Encyclopedia of the Pharaohs
A good reference book on Egypt’s rulers through the New Kingdom
Chronicle of the Pharaohs
All the pharaohs, dynasty by dynasty
Monarchs of the Nile, revised
A nice summary

note: Confused about how they all relate? This book can provide some clarity.
title: The Complete Royal Families of Ancient Egypt

container-title: Volume One: The 18th Dynasty Through Thutmose IV
title: Imperial Lives: Illustrated Biographies of Significant New Kingdom Egyptians
Pharaoh Triumphant
Everything you always wanted to know about Rameses II. Arielle Kozloff, Amenhotep III: Egypt’s Radiant Pharaoh
The life and times of one of Egypt’s most prosperous rulers
The Black Pharaohs: Egypt’s Nubian Rulers
Who Were the Pharaohs?
Names, titles and cartouches of the pharaohs, covering 3000 years of history

note: Another great scholar weighs in on perhaps the most controversial pharaoh of them all.
title: Akhenaten: The Heretic King
Akhenaten by a man who knows him best
Akhenaten: Egypt’s False Prophet
Who’s Who in Ancient Egypt
Not just the rulers, but a lot of other people as well

container-title: The Complete Queens of Egypt: From Early Dynastic Times to the Death of Cleopatra
title: Joyce Tyldesley has authored some wonderful biographies of prominent Egyptian women including: Hatshepsut: The Female Pharaoh
Nefertiti: Egypt’s Sun Queen
and Cleopatra: Last Queen of Egypt
She has also written another related and useful volume
Lives of the Ancient Egyptians: Pharaohs, Queens, Courtiers and Commoners
Profiles of a variety of fascinating individuals. ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES Morris Bierbrier, The Tomb Builders of the Pharaohs
A description of Deir el-Medina, the village inhabited by the workers who constructed the tombs in the Valley of the Kings
The Boat Beneath the Pyramid
The remarkable story of the discovery and reconstruction of the first boat found entombed at the base of the Great Pyramid of Khufu
The City of Akhenaten and Nefertiti: Amarna and Its People
The story of Akhenaten’s short-lived capital as explained by its modern excavator
The Complete Pyramids
An excellent survey by a foremost expert on the subject
City of the Dead
The necropolis of the ancient Theban officials revealed

note: Discoveries of the New Kingdom tombs at Sakkara.
title: The Hidden Tombs of Memphis
Abydos: Egypt’s First Pharaohs and the Cult of Osiris
A great survey of a complicated and vitally important religious and funerary site
City of the Ram-Man: The Story of Ancient Mendes
A prominent Egyptologist provides a rare look at an ancient city in the Nile Delta
The Complete Tutankhamun
There are many books about Tut’s tomb, but this one is especially recommended
The Complete Valley of the Kings
An excellent survey of Egypt’s New Kingdom royal cemetery
Exploring Ancient Egypt
The Complete Towns of Ancient Egypt
The Pyramids: The Mystery, Culture, and Science of Egypt’s Great Monuments
The Millionaire and the Mummies: Theodore Davis’s Gilded Age in the Valley of the Kings
A well-crafted biography of an American “robber baron” responsible for some incredible archaeological discoveries
The Keys of Egypt: The Obsession to Decipher Egyptian Hieroglyphs
An important reference work containing short biographies and bibliographies of persons involved in the exploration and study of ancient Egypt
Egyptomania: Our Three Thousand Year Obsession with the Land of the Pharaohs
The Rediscovery of Ancient Egypt
The ruins of ancient Egypt, as recorded by artists and writers during the last two centuries
Flinders Petrie: A Life in Archaeology
An excellent biography of William Matthew Flinders Petrie, a truly unique figure who excavated numerous ancient sites in Egypt and revolutionized archaeological method and theory
Mummies: Seven Great Discoveries of Egyptian Archaeology
Seven Theban tombs, their occupants and contents comprehensively examined in text and archival photos
The Discovery of Egypt
Travelers, adventurers and scholars in the land of the pharaohs from Roman times through the nineteenth century

note: The biography of the remarkable man who found Tut’s tomb.
title: The Giant Archaeologists Love to Hate
Some may hate him, but they shouldn’t! T.G.H
The Seventy Great Mysteries of Ancient Egypt
In reality, there are far more than seventy mysteries, but this book will provide some insights into several

note: well illustrated and arranged chronologically in order of their finding.
title: The Great Belzoni
One of the great pioneers of Egyptology was an Italian circus performer. (This classic biography is now available in paperback.) C.N. Reeves, Ancient Egypt: The Great Discoveries
A large selection of amazing discoveries

note: Literary musings on themes from mummies to monuments.
title: A Shattered Visage Lies”... Nineteenth Century Poetry Inspired by Ancient Egypt
The Egypt Exploration Society: The Early Years
The story of a remarkable organization that continues today
Wonderful Things: A History of Egyptology: 1: From Antiquity to 1881
A superb history; the first of three intended volumes
Egypt: How a Lost Civilization Was Rediscovered
Signs and Wonders Upon Pharaoh
A history of the early days of American Egyptology

note: Edwards was a Keeper of Egyptian Antiquities at the British Museum and an expert on pyramids.
title: Egypt 1950: My First Visit
A diary illustrated with many photos, conveying the flavor of his experiences and the times, and his encounter with notable personalities
From the Pyramids to Tutankhamun: Memoirs of an Egyptologist
Secrets from the Sands: My Search for Egypt’s Past
The life and times of Egypt’s former director of antiquities
Beneath the Sands of Egypt: Adventures of an Unconventional Archaeologist
A first-hand account of archaeological exploration including excavations in the Valley of the Kings
The Lost Tomb
The rediscovery of KV 5 in the Valley of the Kings, a truly massive tomb built for the many sons of Rameses II
The Art of Medicine in Ancient Egypt
Sports and Games of Ancient Egypt
The Animal World of the Pharaohs
Pharaoh’s People
A discussion of Egyptian society at different levels during the New Kingdom
Growing Up and Getting Old in Ancient Egypt
The Cat in Ancient Egypt
Music and Musicians in Ancient Egypt
Black Land: Daily Life in Ancient Egypt
Ancient Egyptian Medicine
Transport in Ancient Egypt
The Material World of Ancient Egypt
Women in Ancient Egypt
The Pharaoh: Life at Court and on Campaign
Life of the Ancient Egyptians
Daily Life in Ancient Egypt
Daughters of Isis: Women of Ancient Egypt
Judgement of the Pharaohs: Crime and Punishment in Ancient Egypt
Middle Egyptian: An Introduction to the Language and Culture of Hieroglyphs
A modern and highly regarded textbook
How to Read Egyptian Hieroglyphs
A somewhat gentle approach to a complicated subject
Ancient Egyptian Calligraphy: A Beginner’s Guide to Writing Hiero­glyphs

Learn how to draw hieroglyphs. If you can’t find a hard-copy, it’s available on-line from the Metropolitan Museum of Art: www.metmuseum.org/research/metpublications/Ancient_ Egyptian_Calligraphy Alan Gardiner

Both a textbook and a reference grammar. Though not particularly casual reading, beginners might especially find useful the introduction and the essays on royal titles, numbers, etc., and the list of hieroglyphic signs
Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphs: A Practical Guide
This book will soon have you reading actual ancient inscriptions
Egyptian Hieroglyphs for Complete Beginners
Another great book to get you started

container-title: More information is available at: www.museum-tours.com Nigel Strudwick, Hieroglyph Detective
title: Bill Petty has produced a series of handy guides to the ancient language and hieroglyphs for use when examining inscriptions, including a Hieroglyphic Sign List, a portable Hieroglyphic Dictionary, and a “Glyphery
A nice inscription-based introduction

One more recommendation: if you decide to get serious about studying hieroglyphs, it’s good to have a dictionary. A standard volume used by most students (and professionals) is Raymond Faulkner’s Concise Dictionary of Middle Egyptian
Also, some might enjoy The Tale of Peter Rabbit by Beatrix Potter
It’s cute, it’s fun
Ancient Egyptian Literature: An Anthology
Modern translations of ancient romantic poetry and other fascinating texts

container-title: The Literature of Ancient Egypt: An Anthology of Stories, Instructions, Stelae, Autobiographies, and Poetry
title: Each of the volumes deals with a chronological period and offers a wide range of texts in translation
Voices from Ancient Egypt: An Anthology of Middle Kingdom Writings
A truly diverse collection of texts from various contexts
A handy one-volume compilation of some of ancient Egypt’s best-known and most important literary works and historical-­ biographical inscriptions
The Penguin Book of Myths and Legends of Ancient Egypt
Stories and commentary
Egyptian Myths
Life and Death in Ancient Egypt: Scenes from Private Tombs in New Kingdom Thebes
The Tomb in Ancient Egypt
An excellent overview
Magic in Ancient Egypt
Egyptian Mythology: A Guide to the Gods, Goddesses, and Traditions of Ancient Egypt
A particularly excellent presentation, highly recommended
Ancient Egyptian Religion
Exploring Religion in Ancient Egypt
Ancient Egyptian Tombs: The Culture of Life and Death
Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
Journey through the Afterlife: Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead
A beautifully illustrated survey of the guide to successfully achieving eternity
Religion and Ritual in Ancient Egypt
The why and the how
The Complete Temples of Ancient Egypt
The Complete Gods and Goddesses of Ancient Egypt
Egyptian Mummies: Unraveling the Secrets of an Ancient Art
A book by “Mr
Mummies and Death in Egypt
Divine Creatures: Animal Mummies in Ancient Egypt
They didn’t mummify only people
The Mummy in Ancient Egypt
A well-illustrated and fascinating book
Faces of Pharaohs: Royal Mummies and Coffins from Ancient Thebes
Egyptian Art
Ancient Egyptian Jewelry
Encyclopedia of Egyptian Architecture
Egyptomania: The Egyptian Revival
The influence of ancient Egyptian art and architecture during recent centuries
Egypt: 4,000 Years of Art
The Art of Ancient Egypt, revised
The Art and Architecture of Ancient Egypt, revised by W.K
Reading Egyptian Art
Symbol and Magic in Egyptian Art

OF GENERAL INTEREST Shire Publications in the UK publishes a series of little, inexpensive, and typically well-written volumes on a variety of topics in their Shire Egyptology series, including: Predynastic Egypt, Protodynastic Egypt

•• The venerable London-based Egypt Exploration Society, begun in 1882, sponsors archaeological exploration in Egypt and publishes the annual Journal of Egyptian Archaeology, plus a colorful bulletin, Egyptian Archaeology, which appears twice a year
